intro: Piper ibaguense, commonly known as the Ibaguense pepper, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper plants such as black pepper and chili peppers. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, and they are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
